alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 20 at 1:19PM PST until January 23 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST TUESDAY FOR THE TAHOE BASIN ABOVE 6500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations through Monday night 1 to 2 feet above 7000 feet, with 8 to 14 inches between 6500 and 7000 feet. Below 6500 feet, 1 to 5 inches with locally higher amounts up to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph with gusts to 75 mph along Sierra ridges. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...Until 1 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult at times. The hazardous conditions could impact daily commutes through Monday night, with the most widespread impacts expected Monday morning. Gusty winds will create choppy lake waters on Lake Tahoe through tonight with wave heights up to 3 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The main periods of snow are expected this evening through late tonight, and again late Sunday night into Monday morning. At other times, lighter snow will continue mainly near the Sierra crest. Road conditions will vary from wet to slushy and snow covered across the Tahoe region this evening through Monday night, check with Caltrans or NDOT for the latest road conditions.
info.instruction: Even lighter snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways.
